intro: Coccoloba pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican beauty leaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to Central America and northern South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are often brightly colored, ranging from green to red or orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Coccoloba pittieri is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant foliage and ability to add visual interest to gardens.
